metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1693 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Multiple CRLF injection vulnerabilities in the FTP module in Erlang/OTP R15B03 allow context-dependent attackers to inject arbitrary FTP commands via CRLF sequences in the (1) user, (2) account, (3) cd, (4) ls, (5) nlist, (6) rename, (7) delete, (8) mkdir, (9) rmdir, (10) recv, (11) recv_bin, (12) recv_chunk_start, (13) send, (14) send_bin, (15) send_chunk_start, (16) append_chunk_start, (17) append, or (18) append_bin command.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1693` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

erlang - 1:17.3-dfsg-3ubuntu1
erlang-asn1 - 1:17.3-dfsg-3ubuntu1
erlang-base - 1:17.3-dfsg-3ubuntu1
erlang-base-hipe - 1:17.3-dfsg-3ubuntu1
erlang-common-test - 1:17.3-dfsg-3ubuntu1

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: jdstrand> requires MITM between erlang system and ftp server or for the web server to not do input sanitization

criterions.comment: erlang package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:17.3-dfsg-3ubuntu1').
